intro: Psychotria justiciifolia, commonly known as the "Coca plant" in some regions, is a flowering plant native to tropical South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its elliptical, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant is known for containing alkaloids, including cocaine, which has significant pharmacological and medicinal importance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of rainforests. Its botanical features make it both ecologically and economically significant in its native habitats.
